title: Bg. 10.23
sanskrit: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् ।वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरु: शिखरिणामहम् ॥ २३ ॥
transliteration: rudrāṇāṁ śaṅkaraś cāsmivitteśo yakṣa-rakṣasāmvasūnāṁ pāvakaś cāsmimeruḥ śikhariṇām aham

words_trans.vitta-\u012b\u015ba\u1e25: the lord of the treasury of the demigods

literary_trans: Of all the Rudras I am Lord Śiva, of the Yakṣas and Rākṣasas I am the Lord of wealth [Kuvera], of the Vasus I am fire [Agni], and of mountains I am Meru.Of all the Rudras I am Lord Śiva, of the Yakṣas and Rākṣasas I am the Lord of wealth [Kuvera], of the Vasus I am fire [Agni], and of mountains I am Meru.PurportThere are eleven Rudras, of whom Śaṅkara, Lord Śiva, is predominant. He is the incarnation of the Supreme Lord in charge of the mode of ignorance in the universe. The leader of the Yakṣas and Rākṣasas is Kuvera, the master treasurer of the demigods, and he is a representation of the Supreme Lord. Meru is a mountain famed for its rich natural resources.
